content.en: Visible Light Communication (VLC): Researchers have investigated various questions related to visible light communication (VLC) and the role of algorithms in improving its performance. They found that DCO-OFDM performs better than ACO-OFDM and flip-OFDM in terms of transmit power. Adaptive modulation based on ACO-OFDM outperforms DCO-OFDM in low signal-to-noise ratio conditions. A hybrid system combining ACO-OFDM and OOK modulation achieves high spectral efficiency and adapts to different receivers. Other studies explore techniques such as dimmable VLC systems, reducing inter-symbol crosstalk, improving energy and spectral efficiency, and enhancing throughput and reducing peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR) in OFDM-based VLC systems.
content.da: Synlig lys kommunikation (VLC): Forskere har undersøgt forskellige spørgsmål relateret til synlig lys kommunikation (VLC) og algoritmers rolle i at forbedre dens ydeevne. De fandt, at DCO-OFDM præsterer bedre end ACO-OFDM og flip-OFDM med hensyn til transmissionskraft. Adaptiv modulation baseret på ACO-OFDM overgår DCO-OFDM under forhold med lav signal-til-støj-forhold. Et hybridesystem, der kombinerer ACO-OFDM og OOK modulation, opnår høj spektral effektivitet og tilpasser sig forskellige modtagere. Andre studier udforsker teknikker som dæmpbare VLC-systemer, reduktion af inter-symbol interferens, forbedring af energi- og spektral effektivitet, samt forøgelse af gennemstrømning og reduktion af peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR) i OFDM-baserede VLC-systemer.
